txt.en: The tower high atop Beaconwatch is where Lady Answith is awed by the view of the Halifirien.\n\nLady Answith recommended that you view the Halifirien and thus perhaps learn to understand her husband's devotion.
Go up into the tower and witness the view at the Halifirien

Lady Answith is on a porch above the vendor's area north of the Mead Hall in Beaconwatch.\n\nAfter witnessing the breathtaking view of the Halifirien, you have an idea of the sense of duty that Cútha has for keeping watch. You should return to Lady Answith and tell her that you have gazed upon the Halifirien from high atop Beaconwatch.
You have seen the view of the Halifirien

'I do not see my husband as much as I would like, but I understand how important this duty is to him.\n\n'It really is quite breathtaking though. If you have not seen the Halifirien, I recommend you go to the top of the tower next to the Mead Hall to get a good vantage point.'
Lady Answith is awed by the view of the Halifirien from Beaconwatch.

'It is breathtaking, is it? Whenever I get upset that Cútha is busy at watch, I simply go up into the tower and instantly feel better.\n\n'It is honourable that he is so dedicated. Not everyone might appreciate it, but he is simply doing what he must.'
